Generation V.Black: It tends to bite everything, and it is not a picky eater. Approaching it carelessly is dangerous.
Generation V.White: They cannot see, so they tackle and bite to learn about their surroundings. Their bodies are covered in wounds.
Generation V.Black 2: Lacking sight, it's unaware of its surroundings, so it bumps into things and eats anything that moves.
Generation V.White 2: Lacking sight, it's unaware of its surroundings, so it bumps into things and eats anything that moves.

Generation VIII.Sword: When it encounters something, its first urge is usually to bite it. If it likes what it tastes, it will commit the associated scent to memory.
Generation VIII.Shield: Because it can't see, this Pokémon is constantly biting at everything it touches, trying to keep track of its surroundings.

Generation IX.Scarlet: It can’t see, so its first approach to examining things is to bite them. You will be covered in wounds until a Deino warms up to you.
Generation IX.Violet: It nests deep inside a cave. Food there is scarce, so Deino will sink its teeth into anything that moves and attempt to eat it.
